sequenceNumber.description:
Optional.
Used only with individual packages as a unique identifier of each requested package. Will be adjusted at the shipment level as pieces are added.

subPackagingType.description:
Indicate the subPackagingType, if you are using your own packaging for the shipment. Use it for all shipments inbound to Canada (CA) and inbound shipments to the U.S. and Puerto Rico (PR) from Canada and Mexico (MX).subPackagingType is mandatory for shipments to Canada.
Example: TUBE, CARTON, CONTAINER. etc.
Note: If the value is TUBE, a non-machinable surcharge will be applicable for SmartPost shipments.
click here to see Sub-Packaging Types
For more information on physical packaging or packaging regulatory requirements, contact your FedEx representative.

customerReferences.description: This object lists the customer references provided with the package.

customerReferenceType.description:
This is a customer reference type. The value specified here for the element is printed on the Commercial Invoice only for tracking and label information.

Note:

  • The P_O_NUMBER value must be specified in customerReferences under requestedPackageLineItems
  • The INVOICE_NUMBER value that is printed on the FedEx-supplied invoice must be specified in customerReferences under commercialInvoice. Value defined in this section will print on the label that is attached to the package
Note: INTRACOUNTRY_REGULATORY_REFERENCE is applicable only in Intra-Brazil.
For more information, click here for Cutsomer References

value.description:
This is a customer reference type value.
Example: 3686
Note: Maximum length for all customer references is 40 characters.

declaredValue.description: This is the Declared Value of any shipment which represents FedEx maximum liability associated with a shipment. This is including, but not limited to any loss, damage, delay, misdelivery, any failure to provide information, or misdelivery of information related to the Shipment.

amount.description:
This is the amount. Maximum limit is 5 digits before decimal.
Example: 12.45

currency.description:
This is the currency code for the amount.
Example: USD
Click here to see Currency codes

units.description: Indicate the weight unit type. The package and commodity weight unit should be the same else the request will result in an error.

value.description:
This is the weight. Maximum length is 99999.
Example: 68.25

weight.description:
These are the package weight details.
Note: Weight is not required for One rate shipments

dimensions.description:
Indicate the dimensions of the package.
Following conditions will apply:
  • Dimensions are optional but when added, then all three dimensions must be indicated.
  • Dimensions are required with YOUR_PACKAGING package type.
Note: The maximum/minimum dimension values varies based on the services and the packaging types. Refer FedEx Service Guide for service details related to DIM Weighting for FedEx Express and oversize conditions for FedEx Express and FedEx Ground.

length.description:
Indicate the length of the package. No implied decimal places. Maximum value: 999
Example: 20

width.description:
Indicate the width of the package. No implied decimal places. Maximum value: 999
Example: 10

height.description:
Indicate the height of the package. No implied decimal places. Maximum value: 999
Example: 10

units.description:
Indicate the Unit of measure for the provided dimensions.
Valid Values are:
  • IN - inches
  • CM - centimeters
    • Note: Any value other than CM including blank/null will default to IN.

allOf.description:
Indicate the dimensions of the package.
Following conditions will apply:
  • Dimensions are optional but when added, then all three dimensions must be indicated.
  • Dimensions are required with YOUR_PACKAGING package type.
Note: The maximum/minimum dimension values varies based on the services and the packaging types. Refer FedEx Service Guide for service details related to DIM Weighting for FedEx Express and oversize conditions for FedEx Express and FedEx Ground.

groupPackageCount.description:
Indicate the grouped package count. These are number of identical package(s) each with one or more commodities.
Example: 2

itemDescriptionForClearance.description: Describe the content of the package for customs clearance purposes. This applies to intra-UAE, intra-Columbia and intra-Brazil shipments.

contentRecord.description: Use this object to specify package content details.

itemNumber.description: This is a package item number.

receivedQuantity.description: This is the package item quantity.

description.description: This is the description of the package item.

items.description: Use this object to specify package content details.

itemDescription.description:
This the item description for the package.
Note: Item description is required for Email Label return shipments and ground Create tag.
Example: Item description
Maximum limit is 50 characters

rateType.description: This is the rate type used for this package.

percentValue.description:
This is the variable handling percentage. If the percent value is mentioned as 10, it means 10%(multiplier of 0.1).
Example: 12.45

rateLevelType.description: Specifies if the rate level type is either Individual or Bundled.

fixedValue.description:
This is to specify a fixed handling charge on the shipment. The element allows entry of 7 characters before the decimal and 2 characters following the decimal.
Example: 5.00.

amount.description:
This is the amount. Maximum limit is 5 digits before decimal.
Example: 12.45

currency.description:
This is the currency code for the amount.
Example: USD
Click here to see Currency codes

fixed variable handling charge currency type
click here to see Currency codes

rateElementBasis.description: Specify the charge type upon which the variable handling percentage amount is calculated.

variableHandlingChargeDetail.description: Indicate the details about how to calculate variable handling charges at the shipment level. They can be based on a percentage of the shipping charges or a fixed amount. If indicated, element rateLevelType is required.

specialServiceTypes.description:
Indicate the types of special services requested for the shipment.
click here to see Package Special Service Types

signatureOptionType.description:
Indicate the Signature Type.
Valid Values:
  • ADULT - Adult signature required, at recipient address.
  • DIRECT - Signature required, at recipient address.
  • INDIRECT - Signature required, alternate address is accepted.This option is available for residential deliveries only
  • NO_SIGNATURE_REQUIRED - Signature is not required.
  • SERVICE_DEFAULT - Signature handled as per current Service Guide.

enhancementTypes.description:
The types of all enhancement for the Priority Alert.
Example: PRIORITY_ALERT_PLUS

content.description: Specifies Content for the Priority Alert Detail.

signatureOptionDetail.description: This element specifies Signature option details.

alcoholRecipientType.description:
Specify the Alcohol Recipient Type of the shipment.
Example:
  • LICENSEE- FedEx approved alchol shipper having appropriate licenses.
  • CONSUMER- Individual consumer to whom the alchol is shipped.

shipperAgreementType.description: Specify the type of entity, the shipper for alcohol shipment is registered such as fulfillment house, retailer or a winery.

alcoholDetail.description: These are detcontentails for the package containing alcohol. This is required for alcohol special service. The alcoholRecipientType is required.

accessibility.description:
Specify Dangerous Goods Accessibility Type.
  • Inaccessible – it does not have to be accessable on the aircraft.
  • Accessible – it must be fully accessible on the aircraft, and is more strictly controlled.

options.description: Indicate type of DG being reported.

amount.description:
This is the amount. Maximum limit is 5 digits before decimal.
Example: 12.45

currency.description:
This is the currency code for the amount.
Example: USD
Click here to see Currency codes

packageCODDetail.description: These are COD package details. For use with FedEx Ground services only; COD must be present in shipments special services.

batteryDetails.description: Provide details about the batteries or cells that are contained within this specific package.

batteryPackingType.description: Describe the packing arrangement of the battery or cell with respect to other items within the same package.

batteryRegulatoryType.description: This is a regulation specific classification for the battery or the cell.

batteryMaterialType.description: Indicate the material composition of the battery or cell.

units.description: Indicate the weight unit type. The package and commodity weight unit should be the same else the request will result in an error.

value.description:
This is the weight. Maximum length is 99999.
Example: 68.25

dryIceWeight.description:
These are the package weight details.
Note: Weight is not required for One rate shipments

packageSpecialServices.description: These are special services that are available at the package level for some or all service types.

description:
These are one or more package-attribute descriptions, each of which describes an individual package, a group of identical packages, or (for the total-piece-total-weight case) common characteristics of all packages in the shipment.
  • At least one instance containing the weight for at least one package is required for EXPRESS and GROUND shipments.
  • Single piece requests will have one RequestedPackageLineItem.
  • Multiple piece requests will have multiple RequestedPackageLineItems.
  • Maximum occurrences is 30.
